description: For the past decade, smartphone makers have tried to serve two opposing masters. They want to squeeze as much screen as possible into a phone chassis, while at the same time leaving enough room for the front-facing camera (a feature thats become all the more important in the Zoom-centric reality of 2020).  Until now, most companies have solved this tug-of-war by carving out space for the camera in the display  first in the form of a notch, and more recently the hole-punch (with some interesting alternatives like pop-up cameras peppered in between). But notches are distracting at best and ugly at worst; pop-up cameras add weight and make repairs harder; and hole punch designs are incompatible with wide-angle cameras.  So the next question pretty much asks itself: why not just build the camera  right into the display? Its a solution Xiaomi, Oppo and ZTE have all been working on, but only the latter has a product shipping with the technology on store shelves today  and in this video, were taking a close look at just how it works! Join Michael Fisher for MrMobiles Hands-On with the ZTE Axon 20 5G: the first phone with an under-display selfie camera that you can actually buy!
